com.jfbuilds.tme1.program1

Interface CircleInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Circle

    public interface CircleInterface
    Circle represents a simple shape of Euclidean geometry that is the set of all points in a plane that are at a given distance from a given point, the centre

    Various methods are used to calculate derivated values for a circle such as the circumference and area, to move the centre's location, and to set the radius while checking it is within a range of values

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    %I%, %G%
    Author:
    Jean-francois Nepton

    • Method Detail

      • circumference

        double circumference()
        Circumference of the circle
        Returns:
        the circumference of Circle object calculated as PI * (2 * radius)

      • area

        double area()
        Area of the circle
        Returns:
        the area of Circle object calculated as PI * (radius * radius)

      • setRadius

        void setRadius(double r)
        Checks the radius against a maximum. If the radius is greater than the maximum, resets it to the maximum (using the ternary conditional operator)
        Parameters:
        r - length of the center of a circle to it's edge to set

      • printAttributes

        void printAttributes()
        Prints the coordinates, the radius, the circumference, and the area using log4j2 with info level logging

      • getAttributes

        java.lang.String getAttributes()
        Coordinates, the radius, the circumference, and the area of a Circle object
        Returns:
        String details of Circle object including center point, radius, circumference, and area

      • isInside

        boolean isInside(double x,
               double y)
        Checks if a point represented in the parameters falls inside the circle
        Parameters:
        x - horizontal point coordinate
        y - vertical point coordinate
        Returns:
        true the point is inside the circle
        false the point is not inside the circle

      • move

        void move(int x,
        int y)
        Moves the origin of the circle by a specified int type amount
        Parameters:
        x - horizontal point coordinate
        y - vertical point coordinate

      • move

        void move(double x,
        double y)
        Moves the origin of the circle by a specified double type amount
        Parameters:
        x - horizontal point coordinate
        y - vertical point coordinate
